Detailed Description

Utility to compute neighbors in a balanced depth-first tree.

This class is a tool to create a processor tree appropriate for use in collective communication operations. An example of a tree created is 

 *                     0
 *                    / \
 *                   /   \
 *                  /     \
 *                 1       8
 *                / \     / \
 *               2   5   9   12
 *              /|  /|  / \  |\
 *             3 4 6 7 10 11 13...
 *

The tree is as balanced as possible. Nodes that are close together in the tree tends to be close together in natural ordering. Without knowing about the underlying message passing network structure, we assume that close natural ordering usually means close together on the network. Thus nodes close together in the tree are also close together on the network. Thus, communication between nearest neighbors in the tree tend to be faster.

The tree formed by this class has the property that each and every subtree is composed nodes with contiguous natural ordering. This again benefits communication.

Member Function Documentation

void SAMRAI::tbox::BalancedDepthFirstTree::initialize ( unsigned int  first_rank,
unsigned int  last_rank,
unsigned int  rank,
bool  do_left_leaf_switch 
)

Construct the tree.

Initialize the parent, left and right children, given a contiguous range of processor ranks and the desired rank. Initialization has complexity ln(length of range).

The tree is set up for collective communications with the root rank being the first_rank.

Parameters:
first_rank The first in a contiguous range of ranks in the communication group.
last_rank The last in a contiguous range of ranks in the communication group.
rank The rank whose parent and children are sought.
do_left_leaf_switch 
Precondition:
(first_rank <= rank) && (rank <= last_rank)

unsigned int SAMRAI::tbox::BalancedDepthFirstTree::getChildRank ( unsigned int  child_number  )  const [inline]

Access a child rank.

Currently, child_number must be 0 or 1 because we only support a binary tree.

unsigned short int SAMRAI::tbox::BalancedDepthFirstTree::getNumberOfChildren (  )  const [inline]

unsigned int SAMRAI::tbox::BalancedDepthFirstTree::getInvalidRank (  )  const [inline]

What this class considers an invalid rank.

When a parent or child does not exist, this value is returned for the rank.
